Tavatron:

(OOC: If you get this post twice then sorry, but I'm not sure if I sent it 
or not. My friend said no, so I'm gonna send it again, kay?)

Tavatron just stood there for a second. She couldn't believe what she was 
hearing! Tavatron growled menacingly as she unsheathed her drill sword. 
Tavatron heard the call of battle too, but she knew when to lay down her 
weapons and rest!

Dinobot had not risked his life to save hers just to get blown away by some 
pathetic member of the Alliance! Tavatron ran in front of Dinobot, and 
pointed her sword at the center of his chest:

"We have been ordered back to base. You are in no condition to fight. Now, 
either come willingly or, Primus help me, I'll run you through and drag you 
there in stasis lock!"

Tavatron didn't like being so harsh with him. He had done so much for her, 
and she had tried to repay his kindness... with kindness. That was the 
problem. He was a warrior.

Very well, then she would treat him as one. Tavatron sighed inwardly as she 
tried to calm herself. She was truly concerned for his welfare, but at this 
rate he wouldn't survive more than a few nanoclicks in battle. Tavatron knew 
she wouldn't be able to stop Dinobot if he truly wanted to engage the 
alliance, but she would try. Tavatron's expression softened:

"Please, if not for your sake... then for mine."
